content.description: Sit start with a deeply incut left hand sidepull and a right hand edge. From there, climb through edges to the jug, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center of the boulder's south face.

content.description:
Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand on the arete. From there, figure out the awkward footing to establish the arete, then cruise the remainder for an easy finish.

The opening feet give the problem its difficulty.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the south side of the boulder's southeast arete.

content.description:
The start was chalked up before we attempted it, but none of the other holds had chalk on them, so someone else may have gotten the first ascent.

Start with your hands matched on the lower flake/crimp in the middle of the west-facing side of the Western Rust Boulder. Make a couple big moves to the ledges going straight up and then top out. Watch your feet, they start right next to the ground.
content.location:
This is left of the route

Out of Doors

in the middle of the West-facing side of the boulder. The starting hold is the obvious low flake in the middle. Downclimb on the east-facing side.

content.description:
Out of Doors is a pure traverse that climbs bullet rock and ends with an exciting finish.

Sit start from the glassy arete, pull up to a good left hand crimp, and traverse right through a sidepull and gaston on the slightly overhung and solid face.  From there, work two small crimps to your liking, and make an awkward dyno out right to a great jug.  The remaining topout is straightforward.
content.protection: Pad or two, the landing is great though.
content.location: This is on the southwest-face of Western Rust Boulder.

content.description: Start your hands at the bottom of the slanted crack and work your way up the crack to top out. The crux is the very first move because your foot placement is not great.
content.location:
This just to the right of "

Out of Doors

" on the other side of the arete.

content.description: Sit start at the glassy arete. From there, follow the arete to the jug, then use the edges to reach an easy finish.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west arete.

content.description: Sit start matched down low on the sidepull feature. From there, gain the lip, traverse right to the jug, gain the edge, and finish up the easy remainder.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The problem pads well, but the landing is very uneven due to a rock.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's west fast.
